simplesect.title: Cast operators
simplesect.para: Use proper C++ casts when compiled as C++ to be compatible with the option -Wold-style-cast of GCC (and -Werror=old-style-cast in GCC 4.2 and above).

listitem.para: #define SDL_COMPILE_TIME_ASSERT(name, x) typedef int SDL_compile_time_assert_ ## name[(x) * 2 - 1]

section.title: Detailed Description
section.para: This is a general header that includes C language support.

section.title: _SDL_HAS_BUILTIN
section.para: Check if the compiler supports a given builtin. Supported by virtually all clang versions and recent gcc. Use this instead of checking the clang version if possible.

section.title: SDL_arraysize
section.para: The number of elements in an array.

para.computeroutput: #define SDL_COMPILE_TIME_ASSERT( name, x) typedef int SDL_compile_time_assert_ ## name[(x) * 2 - 1]

section.title: SDL_STRINGIFY_ARG
section.para: Macro useful for building other macros with strings in them

para.computeroutput: typedef void *(SDLCALL * SDL_calloc_func) (size_t nmemb, size_t size)

section.title: SDL_acos()
section.para: Use this function to compute arc cosine of x.
The definition of y = acos(x) is x = cos(y).

formalpara.title: Since
formalpara.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.2.

section.para: Get the current set of SDL memory functions

formalpara.title: Since
formalpara.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.7.

section.title: SDL_GetNumAllocations()
section.para: Get the number of outstanding (unfreed) allocations

formalpara.title: Since
formalpara.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.7.

section.title: SDL_iconv_string()

para.computeroutput: DECLSPEC char *SDLCALL SDL_iconv_string (const char * tocode, const char * fromcode, const char * inbuf, size_t inbytesleft)

section.para: This function converts a string between encodings in one pass, returning a string that must be freed with SDL_free() or NULL on error.

formalpara.title: Since
formalpara.para: This function is available since SDL 2.0.0.

section.para: Replace SDL's memory allocation functions with a custom set
